sources.title: The Talk of Hollywood (1929) NAT CARRüçï MARK SANDRICH
sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Directed & Story by: Mark Sandrich
Stars: Nat Carr, Fay Marb√©, Hope Sutherland
‚úÖ for more CLASSIC movies https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLmHgXUJMN1TUzR3YhpzxOuBM6YrZ91UVG
üçï A MARK SANDRICH PRODUCTIONüçï 
Before dazzling audiences with The Gay Divorcee, Top Hat, Shall We Dance, and Holiday Inn, director Mark Sandrich began with a far humbler production‚Äîa low-budget satire about a frantic producer's struggle to make his first sound picture amid the chaos of early talkies. 

Starring Nat Carr in the Samuel Goldwyn-esque role, with Hope Sutherland, Bobby Vernon, and Ethel Wales rounding out the lively ensemble. A low-budget independent effort, it stands as a rare glimpse into the industry‚Äôs growing pains during one of cinema‚Äôs most transformative moments.

Restored and revisited for classic film lovers, this early talkie is both a time capsule and a showcase of Sandrich‚Äôs emerging talent‚Äîyears before he would direct musical landmarks like Top Hat and Holiday Inn.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

Be sure to LIKE, COMMENT, and SUBSCRIBE for more rare, vintage films every WEEK on PizzaFLIX.

##TheTalkOfHollywood #MarkSandrich #PreCodeHollywood #ClassicMovies #OldHollywood #NatCarr #EarlyTalkies #FilmHistory #VintageCinema ##OldHollywood #VintageCinema #ClassicMovies  #ClassicMovieMonday #PizzaFLIX

metadata.Plot: Schlock-movie producer J. Pierpont Ginsburg, after declaring, in a Yiddish accent, that "talking pictures are in their infantry," decides to put all of his savings into a big-budgeted musical, starring the sensation of Paris (with a bad French accent), Adore Renee, and a swishy leading man, Reginald Whitlock. Meanwhile, his daughter, Judy Ginsburg, gets involved in a romance with Ginsburg's Gentile lawyer, John Applegate. His efforts aren't helped any by the projectionist who mixes up the sound-disc reels, with the images not matching the dialogue and sound effects, during a showing for prospective film buyers and exhibitors.
metadata.Writer: Nat Carr, Mark Sandrich, Darby Aaronson
metadata.Actors: Nat Carr, Fay Marbe, Hope Sutherland
